body_html:
@jlopezpena try running the following before running your script

sudo apt-get install google-perftools
export LD_PRELOAD="/usr/lib/libtcmalloc.so.4"

This changes alignment of default numpy array and fixes the slowdown due to feed_dict introduced in 1.6
body_text:
@jlopezpena try running the following before running your script
sudo apt-get install google-perftools
export LD_PRELOAD="/usr/lib/libtcmalloc.so.4" 

This changes alignment of default numpy array and fixes the slowdown due to feed_dict introduced in 1.6
body:
@jlopezpena try running the following before running your script

```
sudo apt-get install google-perftools
export LD_PRELOAD="/usr/lib/libtcmalloc.so.4" 
```

This changes alignment of default numpy array and fixes the slowdown due to feed_dict introduced in 1.6
